CompletedBy.description: CompletedBy is used to choose a different user to the one completing the action.

CompletionDate.title: CompletionDate is used to set a completion date other than "now"

CopyDocumentsToSucceedingActions.title: CopyDocumentsToSucceedingActions is used to override the preference already set on the action

CopyUserFieldsToSucceedingActions.title: CopyUserFieldsToSucceedingActions is used to override the preference already set on the action

LocationCoordinates.title: LocationCoordinates is a pin/point that defaults to the centroid on the Asset's geography object

Document.title: The Document for a Diary will have ContentType = application/vnd.conquest.diarynote+markdown

Address.description:
Address is a URI with a supported scheme (blob://, file://, https://, conquest://, trim://).

- URIs use the canonical '/' path separator (not '\').

- If the path component of a URI contains hex encoded characters, eg. '%20' for a space ' ', the path will be decoded and saved as ' '.

- The [blob://] scheme represents a filesystem that is managed by Conquest. This is the scheme used in "conquest.live"
  All urls take the form 'blob:/${configured-container}/path/to/file.txt'

- The [conquest://] scheme provides a way to encode links to Conquest Objects and Views. See the documentation to learn
  how to construct a conquest link. (TODO documentation link, conquest://? is an alias for "https://link.conquest.live/?")

- The [https://] scheme can be used to link websites, "http" is not supported.

- The [file://] scheme is not available in "conquest.live", it is the default for in-house installations.

- When a [file://] scheme is used to *submit* a document, it refers to a location available on the API Server filesystem. Only configured locations will be accepted.
  A configured location takes the form: 'file://${configured-location}/path/to/file.txt'

- When *submitting* and *serving*, "conquest_documents", is a configured location for the [file://] scheme:
    - "conquest_documents" points to the Conquest Document directory
      For example:
        "file://conquest_documents/relative/path/file.txt" will point to
        "${ConquestDocumentDirectory}/relative/path/file.txt

[Special handling]: For local filesystem paths are as follows. Consumers of the API / End-User apps cannot use local filesystem paths.

- The [file://] scheme is used to *serve* a file, it refers to a location available on the API Server filesystem.

     - If a [file://] scheme uses the prefix "file://MACHINE/", this path path aligns with the underlying filesystem.
       For example: "file://MACHINE/shared/folder/file.txt" translates to the UNC path "\\MACHINE\shared\folder\test.txt"

     - "file://MACHINE/" locations cannot be submitted via. the API.

Address is a protected property. It is not exposed to the end-user in subsequent requests. To reference this document
use the returned Document.DocumentID

CreateTime.description: CreateTime is unique. When adding a document, there is no DocumentID yet, the CreateTime should be used as a key until the DocumentID is retrieved.

Hashes.description: A list of calculated hashes / checksum of the file to be uploaded.

conquest_apiAddDocumentCommand.title:
AddDocumentCommand works in two steps, first you add a record using this command. The command may return AddDocumentCommand.UploadURI
use that URI to post file content. See AddDocumentResult

conquest_apiAddDocumentResult.description:
AddDocumentResult returns the saved Document record and the location (UploadMethod & UploadUri) of where the actual file should be pushed (POST/PUT).

The location may point to the API server itself, or a configured blob storage service.

This location is valid for a period of time or until the upload has completed. Whichever is earliest.

When a client performs an upload, it prepares a request that will write the file to the provided location. If the location *may* require credentials.

UploadHeaders.title: UploadHeaders returns some required headers, like "x-ms-blob-type: BlockBlob" for azure uploads

UploadMethod.title: POST for a web form or PUT to just push the data

UploadUri.description:
UploadUri is where you must post the UploadData.
It is a multipart HTTP upload with the field "document"
for which the document is uploaded to.

For example, you can upload 'inspection-photo.png' like this for a standard web form
```
  curl -i -X POST -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "document=@inspection-photo.png" "${ApiHost}${UploadUri}"
```

Alternatively, use if no metadata needs to be submitted.
```
  curl --upload-file "${ApiHost}${UploadUri}"
```

If the Uri is relative, prefix it with the api origin.

UploadUri will be empty if:
- The Added Document was a link to an existing document (LinkExistingDocument=true)
- The Document Link is not relative to one of the Document Locations (see GetHierarchyNodesQuery{ObjectType=DocumentContainer})

conquest_apiAnyValue.title:
Each field corresponds to exactly ValueType
For example:
  stringValue and nStringValue (nullable) is for ValueType_String

AttributeID.title: AttributeID for the AttributeSet configured on the AssetType

ParentID.title: ParentID is 0 if this is a Facility

conquest_apiAssetEntity.title: AssetEntity is comprised of the Asset's Record and auxiliary fields (calculated, related)

conquest_apiAssetInspectionEntity.title: AssetInspectionEntity is comprised of the Asset Inspection's Record and auxiliary fields (calculated, related)

conquest_apiAssetInspectionRecord.description: DefectRecord is a selection of fields that may be modified directly.

DCID.title: DCID is the Deterioration Curve ID

FunctionID.title:
EXPERIMENTAL: Changing the FunctionID is a Key Parameter for a Valuation type.
Key Parameter changes may require the Expiry Date to be updated

LocationCoordinates.title: LocationCoordinates is a pin/point that defaults to the centroid on the Asset's geography object

TypeID.description: To change the Asset Type for a valuation type, use the ChangeAssetTypeCommand.

conquest_apiAssetRecord.title:
AssetRecord is a selection of fields that may be modified directly.
TODO: Risk, Valuation fields are omitted, they will be introduced later

AttributeType.title: ObjectType is one of the following: AssetType, ActionCategory, StandardAction, StandardDefect, StandardInspection

FieldName.title: FieldName is the Field that appears on the ObjectType, for example, Asset.UserText1

CodeID.title: CodeID refers to a CodeFieldItem in the Unit of Measurement list

expires_in.description: expires_in seconds. For example 3600 is 1 hour.

refresh_token.description: refresh_token for when the 'offline' scope is requested.

conquest_apiCalculateDefectResponseDateP.description: Parameters to calculate a Defect's Response Date calculated from the Current Inspection Date, Asset's Priority and Severity.

DefectID.title: The Defect for which Severities and their the Response Times are configured (on it's Standard Defect)

SeverityID.title: The Severity chosen for the defect

ResponseDate.description: The Response Date calculated from the Current Inspection Date, Asset's Priority and Severity.

CodeListName.title: CodeListName is set for System lists (aka. CodeField)

conquest_apiCompareOperator.title:
- CompareOperator_RangeInclusive: RangeComparisonType
 - CompareOperator_Contains: SetComparisonType
 - CompareOperator_EqualTo: ValueComparisonType
 - CompareOperator_StringStartsWith: String comparisons
 - CompareOperator_DescendentOf: HierarchyComparisonType

conquest_apiConditionType.title:
- ConditionType_WeightedAverage: Weighted Average (Default)
 - ConditionType_ConditionDistribution: Condition Distribution (%)

ParameterObjectType.title: ParameterObjectType is the ObjectType of the parameter that the result is related to

PredefinedContextCriteria.description:
A Context can have some pre-defined criteria that the user can enable or disable when parameterising a Find query.

For example, the related actions Find query can be parameterised with the pre-defined criteria 'Completed' and 'Not Completed'

ResultObjectType.title: ResultObjectType is the ObjectType of the returned result

System.title: This context is pre-defined by the system

AssetID.title: ParentID is 0 if this is a Facility

ParentID.title: ParentID is 0 if this is a Facility

conquest_apiCreateSessionGrantType.description:
- authorization_code: code is used for exchanging an authorization code for an access token
when an application is configured for the 'authorization code flow'
 - refresh_token: a refresh_token is obtained when a session has been created.
It is used for obtaining a new access token when a session has expired.

A refresh token may be provided when a session is created with the 'offline' scope.
 - password: DO NOT USE THIS. This flow has changed. Instead of calling the API, obtain an authorization code from services.

password is a **custom** flow where a USER provides their own credentials directly
to the client application the application itself generates an access token.

For when an application is configured for the 'resource owner flow'.
 - pass_code: pass_code is a **custom** flow for conquest III
so that users can open the workplanner

this flow must be used with the "/redirect/" endpoint

conquest_apiCriteria.description: Criteria is a list of expressions in a 'where' clause that evaluate to true or false.

And.title:
If And is true, all Items must be true for the Criteria to evaluate to true
If And is false, all Items must be false for the Criteria to evaluate to false

Items.title: A list of expressions which evaluate to true or false

conquest_apiCriteriaItem.title: Criteria is an expression in a 'where' clause that evaluates to true or false

AttributeID.title: AttributeID for the AttributeSet configured on the AssetType

SeverityScore.title: The Severity Score of the Standard Defect Response of the selected Severity

conquest_apiDefectEntity.title: DefectEntity is comprised of the Defect's Record and auxiliary fields (calculated, related)

conquest_apiDefectRecord.description: DefectRecord is a selection of fields that may be modified directly.

CostEstimate.description:
google.protobuf.Int32Value ElementList = 44; // Legacy no-one uses it Peter says.
   google.protobuf.Int32Value Element = 45; // Legacy no-one uses it Peter says.

LocationCoordinates.title: LocationCoordinates is a pin/point that defaults to the centroid on the Asset's geography object

SeverityID.title: SeverityID as determined by the Asset's Priority

EnumerationTypeNames.title: EnumerationTypeNames is a list of the "original names" or "tags" of the values in the EnumerationType

FileShouldBeAccessible.description:
FileShouldBeAccessible reports whether the document file SHOULD be accessible.

This depends on two things:
- Is the file from a correctly configured document location?
- Has the file been uploaded successfully (UploadStatus_Completed)?

Link.description:
Link is the location from which a document can be accessed. It is calculated from the document Address.

Link is empty when a location requires accessing a document with a security token.

All uploaded documents will have an empty Link field.

You can obtain an appropriate link which encodes a security token using the GenerateDocumentLinkCommand
OR use the "/download/document?object_type=...&object_id=...&document_id=..." endpoint which will either serve
   the file or redirect to a link, potentially generated by the GenerateDocumentLinkCommand

Name.title: Name is display name. It is the same as the HierarchyNode.Name

Prefix.title: Prefix is a Uri, that always ends with a '/'. It is the same as the HierarchyNode.ObjectKey.StringValue

conquest_apiDocumentContainer.title: DocumentContainer is convertible to a HierarchyNode which does not have a ParentKey nor a FamilyCode

conquest_apiEnumeration.description: Enumeration is a description of the [enum] data types exposed in the API.

enumerationType.title:
type is the DataType of the enumeration
For example:
- If the proto type is Permission, then the type is Permission

DataDirectoryToken.title:
DataDirectoryToken refers to the content in a file "${DataDirectory}/.token"
it is used to check that the gateway and the api refer to the same directory

Hostname.title: Hostname is System.Environment.MachineName in C#, os.Hostname() in golang

UploadsDirectoryToken.title:
UploadsDirectoryToken refers to the content in a file "${UploadsDirectory}/.token"
it is used to check that the gateway and the api refer to the same directory

FieldName.title: view+column as defined by a Context for which this criterion is for

conquest_apiFieldCriterion.title: FieldCriterion is a comparison that evaluates to true or false

Context.description:
Context is a selection of fields with a predefined Criteria. It is like the 'from' clause if a SQL query, a set of "joined tables".

Contexts are defined in the Field Dictionary

This Context is parameterised with the ObjectID for it's respective ObjectType

Criteria.title: The Criteria that filters the Context

FieldNames.description:
FieldNames is the list of fields that will be returned in the RecordSet.

If empty, the default selection of fields will be provided. Otherwise the selected field names, if defined by
the Context, will be returned

FilterID.description: The ID for a UserView. A UserView is constructed using the filter builder.

WithoutDefaultCriteria.description: If true, the PredefinedContextCriteria, enabled by default are not applied.

X_RelatedContexts.title: X_RelatedContexts is a list of ContextDescriptors that the returned objects can use

X_thumbnail_parameter.description:
Currently the only supported value is "medium"

Regarding Blob Storage:

    A thumbnail lives in a different container to the actual documents.

    The thumbnail mount, that corresponds to another mount, has the suffix ".thumbnails". For example: "mount={mount}.thumbnails"

    The layout of a thumbnail container is the following

        by_size/{size}/{blobName}

    For example, for the given blob address (mount=default):

        blob://default/Assets/1/image.png

    The address for a 'medium' sized image will be:

        blob://default.thumbnails/by_size/medium/Assets/1/image.png
X_thumbnail_parameter.title: When a thumbnail is desired, use set the thumbnail parameter

Link.description:
Link is is an authenticated link.
When applicable, the "/download/document?object_type=...&object_id=...&document_id=..." endpoint redirects you to (address in the Location header) to this same value.

LinkExpireTime.description:
Not implemented, tentative.
Links do have an expiry, assume 1 hour.

CodeID.description: if CodeID is greater than zero, the CodeList for this Code will be loaded.

ObjectKey.title: ObjectKey for supported ObjectTypes: Asset, Action, Defect, Request, DocumentContainer

WithCreateTimes.title: WithCreateTimes is used to specify the particular document records to retrieve, by the unique document timestamp 'CreateTime'

WithDocumentIDs.title: WithDocumentIDs is used to specify the particular document records to retrieve, by the unique document timestamp 'CreateTime'

WithUploadStatus.description:
If unset, all statuses will be shown.
When rendering this list, only those with the Completed status are downloadable.

InspectionType.title: from the Inspection Type code list

conquest_apiJobCreationDetails.description: JobCreationDetails of the job when submitted. It doesn't change once created.

error.title:
A short user friendly description of what went wrong.
This is empty unless the JobStatus is one of [JobStatus_Invalid, JobStatus_CompletedWithError, JobStatus_InterruptedWithError]

conquest_apiJobKey.description: The unique key to reference the job. It is returned by all endpoints that submit a job.

last_updated.title:
The time that the state was last updated. State will update when one of the following changes.
a. job status, total_work, work_done, status_description
d. the tracking info used by the job (eg. objects pending and objects created)

status_description.title:
/ A short user friendly description about what's currently happening
/ Defaults to the display name of JobStatus

title.title:
The name of the process for quick identification by the user.
Defaults to the display name of the JobType

total_work.description: Total Units of work. Default is 1.

work_done.description:
Units of work currently completed, progress of process is calculated using = WorkDone / TotalWork.
Default is 0.

error.title:
error is the result when job has stopped and the status is one of
[JobStatus_Invalid or JobStatus_CompletedWithError]

conquest_apiJobResult.title:
JobResult is set after the job has ended, that is, when the status is one of
[JobStatus_Invalid, JobStatus_Completed, JobStatus_CompletedWithError]

creation_details.description: creation_details for when this job was submitted.

progress.description: The progress of the job. This changes during the lifecycle of the job.

result.title:
JobResult is set after the job has ended, that is, when the status is one of
[JobStatus_Invalid, JobStatus_Completed, JobStatus_CompletedWithError]

conquest_apiJobStatus.description:
- JobStatus_Unknown: Unknown is an invalid state. Such a job should be logged and removed from processing.
 - JobStatus_Invalid: Invalid is an end state. It is used to report that a job is incorrectly parameterised.
The JobResult for this state is a JobError.
 - JobStatus_Completed: Completed is an end state.
 - JobStatus_CompletedWithError: CompletedWithError is an end state.
The JobResult for this state is not a JobError. If nothing is returned it will be JobResult.empty
 - JobStatus_Removed: CompletedWithError is an end state.
The JobResult for this state is a JobError.

conquest_apiJobType.description:
- JobType_CsvImport: Csv Import
 - JobType_CompleteActions: Action Completion
 - ForwardPlanningDateChange: Forward Planning Date Change
 - JobType_ConditionRecalculation: Condition Re-calculation
 - JobType_DepreciationRecalculation: Depreciation Re-calculation
 - JobType_IndexationUpdate: Indexation Update
 - JobType_Revaluation: Revaluation
 - JobType_ReplacementCostModification: Replacement Cost Modification
 - JobType_TransactionRollback: Transaction Rollback
 - JobType_ExpiryDateRecalculation: Expiry Date Re-calculation
 - JobType_RiskRecalculation: Risk Score Re-calculation
 - JobType_PostTransactions: Post Transactions
 - JobType_Bundler: Bundler (used for zipping stuff up)
conquest_apiJobType.title: Name these in such a way that it makes that sense to call it 'X Process'

token.title:
TODO decide whether to still do this.
the content of the ${path}.token file that is used to verify that the gateway and child processes
are in-fact referring to the same directory

conquest_apiListAttributeSetsQuery.title:
AttributeSets can be queried using a number of different objects types.
The AttributeSet that will be returned is the one that relates to the ObjectKey

PreferredPrefix.title:
The PreferredPrefix is selected by default.
It does *not* mean production. Every configured location *is* production.
It "can" mean a sub folder!

conquest_apiListHierarchyNodesQuery.description:
WARNING: IMPLEMENTATION INCOMPLETE (API 2.0.5)
  Some endpoints may ignore the parameters below and return more data. DO NOT ASSUME IT WILL STAY THIS WAY.
  Your code should always set the parameters below and assume the expected, not the actual data they currently return.

IncludeSubItems.title:
IncludeSubItems will include any items that are not the children but are defined for a particular object
Such items will have the particular object as the parent but have a different ObjectType to the parent

conquest_apiListHierarchyNodesQuery.title: ListHierarchyNodesQuery gets a list of Hierarchy nodes (ObjectHeaders whose parent ObjectType is the same as the object's ObjectType

Context.description:
A Context provides a set of fields available to a view which uses that Context.
These fields have a source (table or view) and an attribute (column).

Status.title:
for an Asset, 'Read Only' or 'Disposed'
for an Action, 'Read Only', 'At Issue', ..., 'Completed'
for a Defect 'Read Only', 'Completed'

conquest_apiObjectAttribute.description:
ObjectAttribute is a description of an attribute on one of the ObjectTypes.

ObjectAttribute is experimental at the moment for the reason that the actual values it returns
is subject to change as we work on making the following fields correct/consistent.

ValueType, Nullable, Parameter

Parameter.title: The Parameter string that conforms to the ParameterType

conquest_apiObjectAttributeParameterType.title: An ObjectAttribute may be parameterised, ObjectAttributeParameterType indicates how a parameter is interpreted

conquest_apiObjectHeader.description:
ObjectHeader is the name of the object and it's relation to other objects that are a primary part of it's description.

The object for an ObjectHeader is a Hierarchy node if the parent's ObjectType is the same as the object's ObjectType

AttributeSetKey.title: AttributeSetKey refers to the attribute set which describes this object's shape

ParentKey.title: ParentKey refers to the parent that this object is for

TypeKey.title: TypeKey refers to the type which determines this object's business rules

X_RelatedContexts.title: X_RelatedContexts is a list of ContextDescriptors that the returned objects can use

conquest_apiObjectRelation.description:
ObjectRelation specifies a link between objects, it does not specify a direction of the relationship.
The default direction of the relationship is chosen.

Examples of directions
    a --> b
    a <-- b
    a <-> b

conquest_apiObjectType.description:
- ObjectType_Asset: AssetEntity
 - ObjectType_Action: ActionEntity
 - ObjectType_Request: RequestEntity
 - ObjectType_Defect: DefectEntity
 - ObjectType_InspectionProgram: InspectionProgram (HPC key)
 - ObjectType_Location: Values
 - ObjectType_ResourceAssignment: ResourceAssignment is a resource entry on an Action
 - ObjectType_ConditionInspection: A ConditionInspection saves attributes (under InspectionHististory.(InspectionID,AssetID) ) of the current Asset record to history
 - ObjectType_AssetInspection: An AssetInspection saves attributes (under AssetInspection.(AssetID+InspectionID) ) for a given StandardInspection
 - ObjectType_DefectInspection: A DefectInspection saves attributes of a Defect (under DefectInspectionXRef.(Defect+InspectionID) ) to history
 - ObjectType_AssetType: Archetypes / Templates / Descriptions
conquest_apiObjectType.title: ObjectType is for an object of a type with an ID that we can reference

EnabledByDefault.description: EnabledByDefault specifies whether the filter is applied to a Context is no preference is specified.

conquest_apiPredefinedContextCriteria.title: PredefinedContextCriteria is a filter applied to a Context

alias.description:
alias is the column name or SQL alias in a query or user view.

- An alias with a prefix of 2 underscores '__' are reserved for Conquest. These fields are subject to change, they're a temporary solution
  For example, __Title, __Subtitle

WARNING alias is not finalized, don't write code that depends on it.

view.column for non-calculated values defined in a Context (a selection of fields in the Field Dictionary)

caption.title: caption == alias in a user view by default

group.title: For a polymorphic RecordSet this denotes the column group

identity.title:
A list of [RecordColumn]s have multiple ValueType=ObjectKey. Identity states that
this RecordColumn is the identity a RecordRow

index.title: index is always set to a value 0 to n-1, where n is the row length of a column group

valueType.title: If ValueType == ObjectKey, Relation is always set

group.title: For a polymorphic RecordSet this denotes the column group

conquest_apiRecordSet.title: In a RecordSet, for a column_group, the column order in columns list corresponds with the columns in a record row

path.title: path is the name of the field on an object, for example, given an ObjectType of Asset, it could be AssetDescription

conquest_apiRelation.title: Relation refers to an attribute on an object

conquest_apiRequestEntity.title: RequestEntity is comprised of the Request's Record and auxiliary fields (calculated, related)

conquest_apiRequestRecord.description: DefectRecord is a selection of fields that may be modified directly.

LocationCoordinates.title: LocationCoordinates is a pin/point that defaults to the centroid on the Asset's geography object

ApplicationDatabase.title: The database you are connected to

ApplicationUsername.title:
The username specified in the database you are connected to
- For a site-installation, this will likely be your Active Directory login
- For a cloud installatino, this will be the same as your Conquest Services login

LastUsed.title: LastUsed is the last time a form was opened

Order.title: Order, if a history item has an order, it is a "pinned item", otherwise it is a "recent item"

conquest_apiValueType.description:
ValueType summaries all the basic data types that all other datatypes/objects/commands
are build up from.

Each of these data types have two representations in the AnyValue type as follows

If a value is required in an object, then the data type is as is. For a String, the data type is:

  string

  the default value is an empty string ""

If a value is optional in an object, then the data type is a container with a 'value' attribute
For a String the container type is StringValue, it looks like:

  { value: string }

  the default value is NULL (no container)

 - ValueType_String: string
 - ValueType_Boolean: bool
 - ValueType_Number: double
 - ValueType_Int32: int32 aka. int
 - ValueType_Int64: int64 aka. long, bigint
 - ValueType_Decimal: decimal aka. money/currency, fixed-precision
 - ValueType_Date: Timestamp
 - ValueType_DateTime: Timestamp
 - ValueType_Duration: int64 milliseconds, use this to encode TimeStans
 - ValueType_Code: Code (int32) is an item in a user definable list.
 - ValueType_Hierarchy: Hierarchy (ObjectKey) is an item in a hierarchy such as an Asset tree, the Asset Priority hierarchy lists and Action Categories.
 - ValueType_ObjectKey: ObjectKey is an item with an ID and a type such as an Asset, AssetType, View, Document and DocumentContainer (eg. folder). See ObjectTypes.
 - ValueType_Enumeration: Enumeration (int32) is fixed size ordered list of values. Enumerations have specific business rules attached.
 - ValueType_GeographyCoordinate: ValueType_StringList = 14;

ContextPath.description: The ContextPath is the identifier for a field for a given Context. This value takes the form ' view.column', for example 'v_Assets.AssetID'.

ObjectAttribute.title:
ObjectAttribute describes the Field
TODO review, should this be FieldID instead?

mount.title:
A mount is a location. Mounting is the attaching of an additional file system to an application.
You refer to a file in a mount with the scheme 'blob://{mount}/{relativeFilePath}'

type.title:
'azure' provider will store documents in the container
'local' provider will store documents in the {DataDirectory}/BlobStorage directory or

conquest_api_configBlobStoreMode.title:
- BlobStoreMode_Redirect: Clients will receive and be redirected to the blob location
 - BlobStoreMode_Gateway: Clients will download and upload from the blob location, via the API

rules_engine_address.description:
rulesEngineAddress: (default = localhost:9090)
  The address of the Conquest API Rules Engine. The Gateway forwards requests to this port.

 !!IMPORTANT!! DO NOT EXPOSE THIS PORT TO THE INTERNET IT IS PRIVATE TO THE MACHINE

services_address.title:
services_address: (default = https://services.conquest-solutions.com.au)
  You can override this for testing usually we point it to "https://localhost:44302/" on a developer machine

connection_string.title:
connectionString: (required)
  The following properties are supported:
  - Username
  - Password
  - Integrated Security = true or false
  - Server
  - Database

name.title:
name: (required)
  The name that will appear in the connection list

conquest_api_configEventSource.description: 'azureeventgrid' provider will receive events from a topic you've set up in Azure.

verbosity.description: valid values in order of noisy: debug|info|warn|error
verbosity.title:
verbosity: (default = debug)
  This setting changes the verbosity (noise) for log messages. 'debug' is the noisiest. If you're having problems
  this is the setting you want to see everything that's happening

conquest_api_configServicesClientCredent.description:
These can be obtained by either of the following methods:
- Registering your instance of the Conquest API in the Services Portal and adding
  the credentials manually here
- Using the [Link] task in the Conquest Management Console

client_id.title: This is a "Username" for your instance of the Conquest API

client_secret.title: This is a password for your instance of the Conquest API

conquest_api_configServicesClientCredent.title:
ServicesCredentials are the used to connect the Conquest API to services.
These are required to host the API. It is used for tasks like
- Authentication
- Matching Mobile users with self-hosted APIs
- Retrieving user and company preferences
- Submitting service statistics and error logs
